summary: the most common chronic respiratory diseases are asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), affecting around 300 million and 65 million people worldwide. the main cause of exacerbations is infection with respiratory viruses, including rhinovirus, respiratory syncytial virus and influenza. this review will discuss the roles of the MAPK pathways in these processes. a group of proteins known as dual-specificity phosphatases (DUSPs) and MAPK phosphatases (MKPs) have roles in many different processes, with severe implications in airway disease.
